text: this is the calm after the storm the
final battle for Aleppo swept through
the city like a man-made malevolent
tornado all sides in this war were
prepared to destroy a ladder to possess
it in the end of firepower of the regime
and its Russian and Iranian allies was
too much for the fractious rebel
coalition the controlled East Aleppo
this city is the key to northern Syria
right across the country rebels who are
still fighting are on the defensive
the battle for Aleppo lasted four years
more than 200,000 civilians were trapped
in the heat of the fight attacks on
civilians by any side in the war are
crimes if it can be proved they were
deliberate zakariya Mohamed Juma lost
his leg in East Aleppo three months ago
at a clinic run by the International
Committee of the Red Cross he is being
measured for a prosthesis rehabilitation
is painful when you can't walk
supporting a family is even harder it
will take years and billions to rebuild
the east side of Aleppo much of the old
city is in ruins with a photo of his
clothes shop Salah ashram stood in front
of where it used to be
I've seen this much damage elsewhere in
Syria but never in such a wide area
because they can all applaud Allah Abu
Mahmoud is one of the first to return to
his neighborhood jeonyul oh if only they
take away the rubble he said all the
neighbors would come back I model this
corpse were still lying on the road a
month after the battle more are certain
to be buried in collapsed buildings the
hundred dollars on Sharia husband Abu
Muhammad collecting firewood showed
where a motor fragment had hit him look
he said they took out my spleen a kidney
and part of my intestines I've had many
operations when there's almost in every
queue for emergency aid there a tragedy
but soon who's twelve has seen more than
anyone should in a lifetime her
grandmother whom Abdul is using all the
strength she has left to care for her
surviving grandchildren surely $20 of a
year on start my daughter's 15 year old
girl and her son who was seven were
killed my son's three year old daughter
lost a leg another grandson age seven
lost a hand
my family's houses were all destroyed
when Tiffany not our third of my life is
that it's a long have been we don't know
what's hidden in our future the war is
damaged and all of us are me my cousin
lost her leg I saw with my own eyes
my other cousin his intestines were out
of his body when I'm saying oh sorry not
tonight
president acids resurgence in aleppo
means talk about forcing him out
sounds more hollow than ever he is the
strongest he's been since the war
started the empty ruined silent streets
on the former frontlines feel oppressive
no one has tried to move back here it's
haunted by violence and death that is a
homemade mortar designed and built by
the rebels and in itself it's a fearsome
weapon but it is nothing compared to the
power of the russian air force and the
military know-how of the iranians and
their lebanese allies foreign
intervention has transformed this war
and the way it's looking right now
foreigners not Syrians will dictate the
way the war ends the Sun sets in Aleppo
on a dark cold and broken place
it feels like a post-war city but this
is not a post-war country Syria has a
fragile partial truce for the first time
the president and his allies can smell
victory but they are not there yet
Jeremy Bowen BBC news Aleppo
